actions.recommendation: Regular Prostate screening (Examination & PSA levels) is recommended. This can be repeated 1-3 yearly depending on your Urologist’s recommendations.

Overall there were a few markers of raised inflammation in your body & future cardiovascular risk. This can be reduced through lifestyle adjustments such as reducing alcohol intake, regular exercise, diet (increase variety of vegetables) & stress management.
Your cholesterol levels were also found to be raised. We have started you on a low dose statin & can repeat your blood levels in 3/12.
Mild gradual changes in vision reported. We recommend you see an Optometrist as you may need a new glasses prescription. They can also test your Intraocular Pressure to exclude Glaucoma.

Regular Prostate screening (Examination & PSA levels) is recommended. I’m glad to hear that you’ve seen a Urologist & all results were normal. This can be repeated 1-3 yearly depending on your Urologist’s recommendations.
Keep refining your everyday lifestyle choices to improve these. It can take a good 3-6 months to show change. Repeat the tests that were abnormal after this time frame to review.
See an Optometrist as you may need a new glasses prescription. They can also test your Intraocular Pressure to exclude Glaucoma.
